channel.title: Stream Processing on rmoff's random ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Stream Processing on rmoff's random ramblings

item.title: Analysing Network Data with Apache Kafka, KSQL, and Elasticsearch
item.description:
In this article I demonstrated how to use KSQL to filter streams of network event data. As well as filtering, KSQL can be used to easily enrich streams. In this article we’ll see how this enriched data can be used to drive analysis in Elasticsearch and Kibanaâ€”and how KSQL again came into use for building some stream processing as a result of the discovery made.

The data came from my home Ubiquiti router, and took two forms:
